definition: a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: The results, along with the master went up into the mountain to uncle et al found the bandits jubilation.
sentences.chinese: 结果，王福随着舅老爷上山才发现土匪山上一片欢腾。

sentences.english: Beijing is going to be so exciting during the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 奥运会期间北京将是一片欢腾的景象。

sentences.english: Marked by great joy or jubilation; triumphant.
The jubilant throng is like the waves of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 欢腾的人群宛如大海的波涛。

sentences.english: Xiangxi minorities are cheering for the expressway opening.
sentences.chinese: 湘西少数民族群众为这条“富民路”的开通而欢腾。

sentences.english: On hearing of the victory , the nation was transported with joy.
sentences.chinese: 听到胜利的消息，举国上下一片欢腾。

sentences.english: The people exulted at the victory.
Universal celebrations are held and the whole nation is in elation.
The speaker worked the people up into a cheering crowd.
sentences.chinese: 演讲者煽起了人们的情绪，人群一片欢腾。

sentences.english: Quietly I will enjoy peaceful exult rejoice.
sentences.chinese: 静静地享受安全的欢腾。

sentences.english: Class is over. The students are jumping with joy,  just like runaway horses.
sentences.chinese: 下课了，同学们就像脱了缰绳的马一样欢腾起来。

sentences.english: Wan Min jubilation, cheered, China's north and south corners of the country spring tide surging.
sentences.chinese: 万民欢腾，欢呼雀跃，中国南北，五湖四海春潮涌动。

sentences.english: In the United States this weekend is one for celebrating.
sentences.chinese: 这个周末的美国将是一派举国欢腾的场面。

sentences.english: Millions of people rejoiced at the news.
New Year fireworks lamp yuanxiao festival finish and exultation.
sentences.chinese: 过年的炮仗元宵的灯喜庆余韵又欢腾。

sentences.english: Bernd- Schneider : We kindled such a euphoria in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 我们在德国点燃了欣快欢腾的气氛。

definition: lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
